creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mr and Mrs Hart Fessenden
description: crooked, gnarled tree growing from bottom center towards top with sharply downturned branches and white blossoms; inscription at ULQ
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Mark, and Seals

ULQ: [ 清気萬古・婆々鴪（？）膝枝・掩映渓X屋・一巻蘂珠経・為知三復讀 ] (Whirling branches of the plum / Cover my hut by the stream; / Opening my Taoist sutra / I must read it three times to understand it.) (SA)
markings: Japanese inscription at L when rolled; ULQ, rectangular intaglio; UL edge, square intaglio: [静逸] ; UL edge, square relief: [華白月閣]; LRC,red intaglio: [x戯]; square relief at L when rolled, in label
title: Pure Spirit of Antiquity
